items.title: Can i get top 5 confidence ?
items.body: By using detect_lang() we get a variable number of language confidence. Is there any way to get the top 5 language confidence? for a particular string?

items.title: language-detection is not Google's
items.body:
Hi,

In https://code.google.com/p/language-detection/, I can't find any statement saying the project is Google's.

At the end of Readme, you find this:
    Copyright (c) 2010-2014 Cybozu Labs, Inc.

And it has moved to https://github.com/shuyo/language-detection

So I think it's developed by @shuyo and is for Cybozu Labs, Inc. not Google.

Am I missing something?

items.title: PyPI version of langdetect is out of date
items.body: According to the [version release history](https://pypi.org/project/langdetect/#history) on PyPI, `langdetect` was last released in October 2016. There have been several fixes and changes to the codebase since then, including enhanced support for multiprocessing.

items.title: How to add a new profile?
items.body: I made a profile file. Now how can I use it? There should be some function, which accepts a json file or string and adds it to the profiles.

items.title: calling same text again and again gives random language
items.body:
I passes same text several times to detect api and it gives me en and sv randomly.
![langdetectbug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/852334/44102950-ee89787c-9fb8-11e8-839c-5f07e27cde5b.JPG)

detect('jason and his dad get new parts for jasons bike')
'en'
detect('jason and his dad get new parts for jasons bike')
'en'
detect('jason and his dad get new parts for jasons bike')
'sv'

items.title: The langdetect wrongly classify text into danish language category.
items.body:
@Mimino666 
Your library is detecting the following text as 'Danish: da'. Could you please suggest why it is happening. Also, Sometimes, it is able to detect these text kind of occurrences and sometimes not. What could be the reasoning behind that? Is this issue can be fixed?. When I query with the help of 'Regex' on the same column in MongoDB on which I have applied your langdetect, the query catches 51 occurrences of these texts, but the langdetect sometimes categories as 'Danish' & the count is just 2 & the other time just passes them to 'English' i.e fail to catch these occurrences. Also, Is it something to with non-determinism..?

```
print(detect("400 error"))
print(detect("403 error"))
print(detect("410 error"))
print(detect("404 error"))
print(detect("500 error"))
print(detect("503 error"))
```

items.title: LangDetectException: No features in text.
items.body:
I am using langdetect to find foreign languages in a field in my MongDB database. While implementing it, I get to know that langdetect is scared of EMPTY strings, floating NaNs & URLs. 
I removed all the above conditions. But again, I am not able to find where langdetect is stuck again?  The detection is running on the "Description" field. There were around 34k records in the feild, when I randomly try to stop the loop till 7000 iteration, it has detected 1k foreign text, but after it failed. Can anyone suggest a way to see the record where it is failing. So that I can inspect a reason?
Below is the code:
`onlyText= data[['_id','Title','Text','Description']].set_index('_id').T.to_dict('list')
print('original Len:',len(onlyText))`
# remove NaN.
`nanRemoved={}
for key,val in onlyText.items():
    if str(val[2]) != 'nan':
        nanRemoved[key]=val
print('Len. after removing floating NaNs:',len(nanRemoved))`       
# remove empty strings.      
`emptyStringRemoved={}
for key,val in nanRemoved.items():
    if len(val[2])>0:
        emptyStringRemoved[key]=val
print('Len. after removing EMPTY strings:',len(emptyStringRemoved))`
# remove only Urls
`import re
url_cleaned={}
stop=0
import urlmarker
for key,val in emptyStringRemoved.items():
       if re.findall(urlmarker.URL_REGEX, val[2]):
        if re.findall(r"/((([A-Za-z]{3,9}:(?:\/\/)?)(?:[\-;:&=\+\$,\w]+@)?[A-Za-z0-9\.\-]+|(?:www\.|[\-;:&=\+\$,\w]+@)[A-Za-z0-9\.\-]+)((?:\/[\+~%\/\.\w\-_]*)?\??(?:[\-\+=&;%@\.\w_]*)#?(?:[\.\!\/\\\w]*))?)/",val[2]):
        stop+=1
       else:
        url_cleaned[key]=val
print('No. urls found:',stop)
print('Len. after removing Articles containing with URLs',len(url_cleaned))`

# start the langauge detection of the articles fields
`from langdetect import DetectorFactory
DetectorFactory.seed = 0
from langdetect import detect
defaulted={}
for key,val in url_cleaned.items():
    if detect(val[2]) !='en':
        defaulted[key]=val
print('Len. of articles having Foreign Text:',len(defaulted))`

`---------------------------------------------------------------------------
LangDetectException                       Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-248-c8c970f9c704> in <module>()
     39 for key,val in url_cleaned.items():
     40 #     stop=+1
---> 41     if detect(val[2]) !='en':
     42         defaulted[key]=val
     43 #     if stop ==15000:

> Output of any of the regex:

/Applications/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/langdetect/detector_factory.py in detect(text)
    128     detector = _factory.create()
    129     detector.append(text)
--> 130     return detector.detect()
    131 
    132 

/Applications/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/langdetect/detector.py in detect(self)
    134         which has the highest probability.
    135         '''
--> 136         probabilities = self.get_probabilities()
    137         if probabilities:
    138             return probabilities[0].lang

/Applications/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/langdetect/detector.py in get_probabilities(self)
    141     def get_probabilities(self):
    142         if self.langprob is None:
--> 143             self._detect_block()
    144         return self._sort_probability(self.langprob)
    145 

/Applications/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/langdetect/detector.py in _detect_block(self)
    148         ngrams = self._extract_ngrams()
    149         if not ngrams:
--> 150             raise LangDetectException(ErrorCode.CantDetectError, 'No features in text.')
    151 
    152         self.langprob = [0.0] * len(self.langlist)

LangDetectException: No features in text.`

Please suggest.

items.title: langdetect doesn't seem to play nicely with multiprocessing by default
items.body:
Just wanted to bring your attention to this stackoverflow discussion: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43268201/typeerror-init-missing-1-required-positional-argument-message-using-multip/43269116#43269116

I am not sure of exactly how this is happening and if I have more time, I will try and reproduce on a publicly available dataset and put the code here for further diagnosis. But it might be worth add the fix I described there to the readme?

items.title: Check if text belongs to a specific language
items.body:
**Problem:**
Langdetect doesn't have an efficient implementation for checking if text belongs to a specific language. 

**Proposed solution:**
Implement a simple `check_language` method that takes some text and the language as an argument. Returns a `bool` that indicate if the language matches.

items.title: How to restrict the list of accepted languages
items.body:
How can I restrict the list of accepted languages to the following:

- bg: Bulgarian
- cs: Czech
- da: Danish
- de: German
- el: Greek
- en: English
- es: Spanish
- et: Estonian
- fi: Finnish
- fr: French
- ga: Irish
- hr: Croatian
- hu: Hungarian
- it: Italian
- lt: Lithuanian
- lv: Latvian
- mt: Maltese
- nl: Dutch
- pl: Polish
- pt: Portuguese
- ro: Romanian
- sk: Slovak
- sl: Slovenian
- sv: Swedish

Currently, the date "23 ноември 2010 година" is detected as "mk" (Macedonian) instead of "bg" (Bulgarian).

Could you help, please.

items.title: UnicodeDecodeError
items.body:
I test this code by IDLE. my code file is encoded by UTF-8:
```
from langdetect import detect_langs

print detect_langs('こんにちは')
```
And got an error:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\TUAN\Desktop\test.py", line 3, in <module>
    print detect_langs('こんにちは')
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector_factory.py", line 137, in detect_langs
    return detector.get_probabilities()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 143, in get_probabilities
    self._detect_block()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 147, in _detect_block
    self.cleaning_text()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 122, in cleaning_text
    elif ch >= six.u('\u0300') and unicode_block(ch) != 'Latin Extended Additional':
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe3 in position 0: ordinal not in range(128)
```

items.title: detect() not picking top language
items.body:
Having an issue here. Should detect() always return the highest probability language?

```
>>> x = '''Imagenes accesibles a todos en Twitter'''
>>> import langdetect
>>> langdetect.detect_langs(x)
[es:0.857137818744, en:0.142858598247]
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'es'
>>> x
'Imagenes accesibles a todos en Twitter'
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'en'
>>> langdetect.detect_langs(x)
[es:0.714283198255, en:0.285714266874]
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'en'
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'es'
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'en'
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'es'
>>> langdetect.detect(x)
'en'
```

items.title: Why there are probabilities returned as strings?
items.body:
I am currently using `detect_langs()` an my text and it seems that it actually returns probabilities as strings instead of floats.
I would like to ask if there is some reason for this and if that wouldn't be better to return them as floats? I'm converting them always manually, but wouldn't be better to directly return floats?

items.title: Non Determinism
items.body:
calling detect on the following string returns 'fr' most of the time, but 'en' some of the time. python 3.4. "Appuyez le projet de loi S-217 pour un minimum de 40% de femmes et d'hommes dans les CA\r\nSupport Bill S-217 to establish a minimum of 40% of men and women on the boards of directors

FRA - Les canadiennes participent activement au milieu des affaires à titre de propriétaires d’entreprises, d’actionnaires, de dirigeantes, de gestionnaires et d’employées et elles jouent un rôle tout aussi important sur le marché en tant que consommatrices, elles devraient donc être représentées de façon équilibrée sur les conseils d’administration. Appuyez le projet de loi S-217  pour établir un minimum de 40% de femmes et d'hommes dans les CA des sociétés d'État et des entreprises côtées en bourse.

\r\n

ENG - Canadian women are actively involved in the corporate community as business owners, shareholders, executives, managers and employees, and they play an equally important role in the marketplace as consumers, they should have balanced representation on boards of directors. Support Bill S-217 to establish a minimum  of 40% of men and women on the boards of directors of Crown corporations and publicly traded companies.

"

items.title: Error when input is only a URL
items.body:
Context: grabbing text posts from Tumblr, one unique snowflake made a text post containing nothing except two Youtube URLs instead of making an actual video post or two, which my code would ignore entirely.  (Note: The following sample code does not contain either of the actual URLs I encountered.  Apologies in advance. #sorrynotsorry)

``` python
from langdetect import detect
detect('https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ')

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector_factory.py", line 130, in detect
    return detector.detect()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 135, in detect
    probabilities = self.get_probabilities()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 142, in get_probabilities
    self._detect_block()
  File "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector.py", line 149, in _detect_block
    raise LangDetectException(ErrorCode.CantDetectError, 'No features in text.')
langdetect.lang_detect_exception.LangDetectException: No features in text.
```

I think I understand why this is happening -- detect is stripping out the URL correctly, leaving an empty string, which also causes detect() to raise an exception.  So what the heck do I do about this?  Does langdetect have any capacity to deal with this situation where cleaning results in an empty string, or do I just have to suck it up and hack together my own logic to detect URLs and replace them with something else\* to deal with this dumb edge case?

*It looks like "xxx" would be a suitable replacement, which is detected by itself as language 'so', that way the previously mentioned post would be ignored by my code as not English.

items.title: is bug?
items.body:
``` python
>>> from langdetect import detect
>>> detect("Ein, zwei, drei, vier")
'de'
>>> detect("dog")
'pt'
>>> detect("ไง")
'th'
>>> detect("ไทย")
'th'
>>> detect("dog")
'pt'
>>> detect("dog")
'pt'
>>> detect("Ein, zwei, drei, vier")
'de'
>>> detect("cat")
'it'
```

dog is a pt lang. Is not an english language ? I require an  english language.
Thank you.

Could you, please, point me to the format or the name of the format?

Thanks!

items.title: detect and detect_langs results are non-deterministic
decoding error in load profile
items.body:
When running langdetect.detect I get the following error:

```
det_lang = langdetect.detect(lang)
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector_factory.py", line 122, in 
    init_factory()
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector_factory.py", line 119, in init_factory
    _factory.load_profile(PROFILES_DIRECTORY)
  File "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\langdetect\detector_factory.py", line 56, in load_profile
    raise LangDetectException(ErrorCode.FormatError, 'Profile format error in "%s" %s' % (filename, err))
langdetect.lang_detect_exception.LangDetectException: Profile format error in "C:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\langdetect\profiles\af" 'charmap' codec can't decode byte 0x81 in position 738: character maps to <undefined>
```

I am using Anaconda 3
What fixes it for me is 

in "detector_factory.py", line 47 add "encoding='utf8'"
f = open(filename, 'r', encoding='utf8')

perhaps you didn't use the encoding because it breaks your supported languages that I am not aware of.
Note that I tested it on English and traditional Chinese

items.title: Speed
items.body:
Michal - I've been playing around with your pure python port of language-detection - it's very good.  My only problem with it is that it's too slow on the data sets I'm using, which are contained in large pandas DataFrames and Series objects.  I'm generally using apply with "detect" as the function on a series that contains hundreds of thousands to millions of entries where each entry is about 150-200 characters.  

I looked through the code a bit to see how I might speed it up.  I was wondering if you have tried at any point incorporating numpy or anything of that nature?  Perhaps you might have other recommendations to get performance to a reasonable time frame?
